alert.note: Alert for Luzerne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 1:23PM EDT until July 09 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN LUZERNE COUNTY... At 123 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding may be ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Rainfall has temporarily ended, but is expected to move back into the area this afternoon. When this occurs, flooding could increase and become worse. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hazleton, West Hazleton, Freeland, Bear Creek, White Haven, Bear Creek Village, Woodside-Drifton, Drifton, Mountain Top, Penn Lake Park, Jeddo, Reily, Tunnel, Nescopeck State Park, Ashmore, Stockton, Forest Park and Jeanesville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
